org.cloudifysource.esc.driver.provisioning
Interface ProvisioningDriver

All Known Implementing Classes:
CloudDriverSupport, MicrosoftAzureCloudDriver, PrivateEC2CloudifyDriver
Deprecated. 

@Deprecated
public interface ProvisioningDriver

The main interface for cloud driver implementations. All calls to scale-out/scale-in/bootstrap are executed via this interface. A single instance of the implementing class will exist for each service in the cluster. An instance will also be created when bootstrapping or tearing down a cloud environment.

Author:
barakme

Method Detail

setConfig

void setConfig(Cloud cloud,
               String cloudTemplate,
               boolean management,
               String serviceName)
               throws CloudProvisioningException
Deprecated. 
Called once on startup of the cloud driver, passing the cloud configuration to it.

Parameters:
cloud - The cloud configuration for this driver
cloudTemplate - The template required for this cloud driver.
management - true if this driver will launch management machines, false otherwise.
serviceName - The name of the service that is planned to be installed on this machine. Could be null if this is a management machine hosting more than one service
Throws:
CloudProvisioningException - Indicates invalid cloud configuration

getComputeContext

Object getComputeContext()
Deprecated. 
Returns the compute context.

Returns:
Compute context object or null if not set

setAdmin

void setAdmin(org.openspaces.admin.Admin admin)
Deprecated. 
Passes an Admin API object that can be used to query the current cluster state. The Admin API is typically only required for advanced use cases, like BYON. Note that this method is only called when the cloud driver is running in the ESM. The cloud driver instance used to create management machines will not get an Admin instance (in all likelihood, an Admin instance running in the client is not useful, as it will run on the wrong side of the firewall.) IMPORTANT: do not perform any blocking operations on this Admin instance as it is running in single threaded mode. Trying to use waitFor() methods on this instance will wither block forever or fail with a timeout.

Parameters:
admin - an instance of the Admin API, running in single threaded mode.

startMachine

org.cloudifysource.esc.driver.provisioning.MachineDetails startMachine(String locationId,
                                                                       long duration,
                                                                       TimeUnit unit)
                                                                       throws TimeoutException,
                                                                              CloudProvisioningException
Deprecated. 
Starts an additional machine on the cloud , on the specific location, to scale out this specific service. In case of an error while provisioning the machine, any allocated resources should be freed before throwing a CloudProvisioningException or TimeoutException to the caller.

Parameters:
duration - Time duration to wait for the instance.
unit - Time unit to wait for the instance.
locationId - the location to allocate the machine to.
Returns:
The details of the started instance.
Throws:
TimeoutException - In case the instance was not started in the allotted time.
CloudProvisioningException - If a problem was encountered while starting the machine.

startManagementMachines

org.cloudifysource.esc.driver.provisioning.MachineDetails[] startManagementMachines(long duration,
                                                                                    TimeUnit unit)
                                                                                    throws TimeoutException,
                                                                                           CloudProvisioningException
Deprecated. 
Start the management machines for this cluster. This method is called once by the cloud administrator when bootstrapping a new cluster.

Parameters:
duration - timeout duration.
unit - timeout unit.
Returns:
The created machine details.
Throws:
TimeoutException - If creating the new machines exceeded the given timeout.
CloudProvisioningException - If the machines needed for management could not be provisioned.

stopMachine

boolean stopMachine(String machineIp,
                    long duration,
                    TimeUnit unit)
                    throws InterruptedException,
                           TimeoutException,
                           CloudProvisioningException
Deprecated. 
Stops a specific machine for scaling in or shutting down a specific service.

Parameters:
machineIp - host-name/IP of the machine to shut down.
duration - time to wait for the shutdown operation.
unit - time unit for the shutdown operations
Returns:
true if the operation stopped the machine, false if the machine was already stopped.
Throws:
InterruptedException - If the operation was interrupted.
TimeoutException - If the operation exceeded the given timeout.
CloudProvisioningException - If the stop operation encountered an error.

stopManagementMachines

void stopManagementMachines()
                            throws TimeoutException,
                                   CloudProvisioningException
Deprecated. 
Stops the management machines.

Throws:
TimeoutException - in case the stop operation exceeded the given timeout.
CloudProvisioningException - If the stop operation failed.

getCloudName

String getCloudName()
Deprecated. 
Returns the name of this cloud.

Returns:
the name of the cloud.

close

void close()
Deprecated. 
Called when this bean is no longer needed. Close any internal bean resources.

See Also:
- for cleaning up cloud resources.

addListener

void addListener(ProvisioningDriverListener listener)
Deprecated. 
Adds a new listener. It is the responsibility of the cloud driver developer to publish a list of supported events.

Parameters:
listener - A class that implements ProvisioningDriverListner.

onServiceUninstalled

void onServiceUninstalled(long duration,
                          TimeUnit unit)
                          throws InterruptedException,
                                 TimeoutException,
                                 CloudProvisioningException
Deprecated. 
Called after service has uninstalled. Used to implement cloud resource cleanup for this service.

Parameters:
duration - time to wait for the shutdown operation.
unit - time unit for the shutdown operations
Throws:
InterruptedException - If the operation was interrupted.
TimeoutException - If the operation exceeded the given timeout.
CloudProvisioningException - If the operation encountered an error.
